register.name: PHY_ID_0
register.comment: PHY ID 0, ASCII "PHY-"

register.name: PHY_ID_1
register.comment: PHY ID 1, ASCII BANDWIDTH,TX_SS,RX_SS,TC

register.name: PHY_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: PHY configuration (one for each of the two paths in RSDB builds)

register.name: PHY_RESET
register.comment: Async reset for phy blocks

register.name: PHY_RAM_POWER
register.comment: RAM power controls for various sections of the PHY

register.name: PHY_RAM_POWER_SEQ
register.comment: RAM power controls for sequencing ON->OFF OFF->ON ON->RET and RET->ON. Shared between all power sequencers these fields set the RAM power up/down sequences. This varies with SoC technology node. For 8nm, in each three bit field, bit 2 is unused, bit 1 is PDE and bit 0 is RETN, normally 0b011 for power off, 0b001 for power on. For 5nm and 4nm, in each three bit field, bit 2 is unused, bit 1 is PDE and bit 0 is RET, normally 0b010 for power off, 0b000 for power on.

register.name: PHY_STATUS

register.name: PHY_SEMAPHORE[1]

register.name: PHY_SEMAPHORE[2]
register.comment: General-use mutual exclusion lock for a single resource

register.name: PHY_SEMAPHORE_3
register.comment: General-use mutual exclusion lock for up to 2 resources

register.name: PHY_DEBUG_SELECT[0]
register.comment: Controls bits 31:16 and 15:0 of the debug multiplexers' output. The multiplexers are organized hierarchically, one nibble controlling multiplexer at each hierarchical level. Selecting 0 for any of the multiplexer positions disables the debug output, setting PHY_DEBUG_SELECT_0 for both bus segments to zero disables the clock to any debug logic.

register.name: PHY_DEBUG_SELECT[1]
register.comment: Controls bits 31:16 and 15:0 of the debug multiplexers' output. The multiplexers are organized hierarchically, one nibble controlling multiplexer at each hierarchical level. Selecting 0 for any of the multiplexer positions disables the debug output, setting PHY_DEBUG_SELECT_0 for both bus segments to zero disables the clock to any debug logic.

register.name: PHY_DEBUG_READ
register.comment: Reads the instantaneous value of the output of the debug multiplexers.

register.name: PHY_FEATURES
register.comment: Enable bits for the features implemented in PHY

register.name: BBA_BF_RX_DMA_EN
register.comment: Beamformee 0 DMA channel enable

register.name: BBA_BF_RX_DMA_BASE_ADDR
register.comment: Beamformee 0 base address is treated as 16-byte aligned by the DMA engine. The four LSBs are used only to set the initial bit position for the first data to be packed. The DMA will write only complete 16-byte words.

register.name: BBA_BF_RX_DMA_BUFFER_LEN
register.comment: Beamformee 0 buffer length must be 16-byte aligned, four LSBs are ignored

register.name: BBA_BF_RX_STATUS
register.comment: BBA beamformee status

register.name: BBA_BF_RX_DMA_CUR_ADDR
register.comment: Beamformee0 DMA read current address

register.name: BBA_BF_TX_DMA_CONTROL
register.comment: This register controls the beamformer angle fetch DMA

register.name: BBA_BF_TX_DMA_BASE_ADDR
register.comment: Beamformer angle fetch DMA base address, can be any byte address. The base address is treated as 16-byte aligned by the DMA engine. The four LSBs are used by the beamformer set the initial bit position for the first data to be unpacked.

register.name: BBA_BF_TX_DMA_BUFFER_LEN
register.comment: Beamformer angle fetch buffer length (bytes)

register.name: BBA_BF_TX_STATUS
register.comment: Beamformer status

register.name: BBA_BF_TX_DMA_CUR_ADDR
register.comment: Beamformer DMA read current address

register.name: DMA_INTERRUPT_DISABLE

register.name: DMA_INTERRUPT_ENABLE
register.comment: Interrupt enable/disable and pending events clear - Enable interrupt/read enable status

register.name: DMA_INTERRUPT_CLEAR
register.comment: Interrupt enable/disable and pending events clear - Clear interrupt/read pending interrupt status

register.name: DMA_INTERRUPT_RAW
register.comment: Interrupt enable/disable and pending events clear - Read incoming interrupt status

register.name: DFE_SIG_ENABLE
register.comment: Enable bits for signal generator and signal analyser

register.name: DFE_SIGGEN_CONFIG[0]
register.comment: Register to control operation of the internal signal generator. SigGen must be enabled in DFE_SIGGEN_ENABLE to start

register.name: DFE_SIGGEN_CONFIG2[0]
register.comment: Register to control operation of the internal signal generator - logical extension of DFE_SIGGEN_CONFIG

register.name: DFE_SIGGEN_FREQ[0][0]
register.comment: This sets the frequency of each tone used by the signal generator. The value for a given frequency can be found by multiplying by 65_536 and dividing by the sample rate of the injection point. When multiple tones are enabled, output will be scaled down automatically to avoid clipping.

register.name: DFE_SIGGEN_FREQ[0][1]
register.comment: This sets the frequency of each tone used by the signal generator. The value for a given frequency can be found by multiplying by 65_536 and dividing by the sample rate of the injection point. When multiple tones are enabled, output will be scaled down automatically to avoid clipping.

register.name: DFE_SIGGEN_PHASE[0][0]
register.comment: This register has several functions: It is the phase value preloaded into the accumulator used to generate each tone, except the last tone. The last tone always starts with phase 0. Register index 0 is used to provide the DC level in DC output mode. It also affects I and Q phases in pseudo-random signal mode.

block.name: phy_fleximac
block.comment: PHY FlexiMAC control and status registers

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR1
register.comment: Tx parameters required to be set before start of transmission

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR1_STS
register.comment: Tx parameters required to determine space time streams

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR1_DFE_RF[0]
register.comment: DFE and RF Tx parameters required to be set before start of transmission. For non-mimo modes register 0 is used. For MIMO modes the registers are used to allow configuration of the different Tx chains

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR1_DFE_IQ_COMP[0]
register.comment: DFE transmit I/Q scaling and phase compensation

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR1_DFE_IQ_OFFSET[0]
register.comment: DFE transmit I/Q DC offset compensation

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR1_DFE_DPD[0]
register.comment: DFE transmit I/Q DC offset compensation

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR1_DFE_RF[1]
register.comment: DFE and RF Tx parameters required to be set before start of transmission. For non-mimo modes register 0 is used. For MIMO modes the registers are used to allow configuration of the different Tx chains

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR1_DFE_IQ_COMP[1]
register.comment: DFE transmit I/Q scaling and phase compensation

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR1_DFE_IQ_OFFSET[1]
register.comment: DFE transmit I/Q DC offset compensation

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR1_DFE_DPD[1]
register.comment: DFE transmit I/Q DC offset compensation

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_TIMER
register.comment: Internal PHY delays from MAC TxEnable rising edge

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR1_PAPR
register.comment: PAPR Threshold

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR2_PARAM1
register.comment: Allows the CPU to write the Tx parameters required before the end of LTF1 transmission

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR2_PARAM2
register.comment: Allows the CPU to write the Tx parameters required before the end of LTF1 transmission

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR2_LENGTH
register.comment: Allows the CPU to write the Tx parameters required before the end of LTF1 transmission

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_VECTOR3
register.comment: HT-GF: Allows the CPU to write the required Tx parameters before the end of HT-LTF1 transmission. all other packet types : Allows the CPU to write the required Tx parameters before the end of LTF2 transmission.

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_SIGNAL_LSIG
register.comment: L-SIG contents: Must be set before the end of LTF1 transmission.

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_SIGNAL_SIG1
register.comment: HT-GF contents: Must be set before the end of HT-LTF1 symbol transmission. HT-MM/VHT/HE SIG1 contents: Must be set before the end of L-LTF2 symbol transmission.

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_SIGNAL_SIG2
register.comment: HT-GF contents: Must be set before the end of HT-LTF1 symbol transmission. HT-MM/VHT/HE SIG1 contents: Must be set before the end of L-LTF2 symbol transmission.

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_SIGNAL_SIGB
register.comment: VHT SIGB contents. Needs to be set before the end of L-LTF2 symbol transmission.

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_STATUS
register.comment: Tx parameters required to be set before start of transmission

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_TX_SPARE
register.comment: Spare, reserved

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_TIMER
register.comment: Internal PHY delays from MAC RxEnable rising edge

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_VECTOR1
register.comment: Rx parameters from received packet, zero when no packet has been received

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_VECTOR2
register.comment: Rx parameters from received packet

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_VECTOR3
register.comment: Rx parameters from received packet

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_TB_VECTOR1
register.comment: Configuration1 for Rx trigger based packet

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_TB_VECTOR2
register.comment: Configuration2 for Rx trigger based packet

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_TB_VECTOR3
register.comment: Configuration3 for Rx trigger based packet

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_FREQ_OFF[0]
register.comment: Signed Rx frequency offset measurements from received packet per selected antenna. For OFDM, offset = reg * 625kHz / 65536; For CCK, offset = reg * 1000kHz / 65536

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_SIG_QUAL[0]
register.comment: Rx signal quality measurements from received packet, per selected antenna

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_RCPI[0]
register.comment: Rx received channel power indicator from received packet per selected antenna, equal to (rx_power_in_dBm+110)*2

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_WRSSI[0]
register.comment: Rx AGC gain related information per antenna

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_WRSSI[1]
register.comment: Rx AGC gain related information per antenna

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_L_SIG
register.comment: Contents of the Legacy (Non-HT) Signal field

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_HT_SIG1
register.comment: Contents of the HT-SIG(1) field

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_HT_SIG2
register.comment: Contents of the HT-SIG(2) field

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_VHT_SIG_A1
register.comment: Contents of the VHT-SIG(A1) field

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_VHT_SIG_A2
register.comment: Contents of the HT-SIG(A1) field

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_VHT_SIG_B
register.comment: Contents of the HT-SIG(B) field

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_HE_SIG_A1
register.comment: Contents of the HE-SIG(A1) field

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_HE_SIG_A2
register.comment: Contents of the HE-SIG(A2) field

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_HE_SIG_B_COMMON_PART1
register.comment: Contents of the HE-SIGB Common Block content_channel[31:0]

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_HE_SIG_B_COMMON_PART2
register.comment: Contents of the HE-SIGB Common Block content_channe2[31:0]

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_HE_SIG_B_COMMON_PART3
register.comment: Contents of the HE-SIGB Common Block {content_channe2[32],content_channe1[32]} and CRC

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_HE_SIG_B_USER0
register.comment: Contents of the HE-SIGB User field targeted for us (where the STA-ID matches the register TODO)

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_SCRAM_SEED
register.comment: Received Scrambling Seed

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_STATUS
register.comment: Receive status

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_LOW_ENERGY_STATUS
register.comment: Low Power indication from BBB and BBA modems.

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_BFEE
register.comment: Beamformee Average SNR

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_SIGNAL_RMS_GAIN_COMP_CONT[0][0]
register.comment: OFDM digital energy measured in each channel per selected Rx antenna. The energy is multiplexed on each 20MHz Channel depending on the PHY_CONFIG.PhyConfigPrimaryChan value so that the Primary20 Mhz subband is always mapped to Channel 0.

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_SIGNAL_RMS_GAIN_COMP_CONT[0][1]
register.comment: OFDM digital energy measured in each channel per selected Rx antenna. The energy is multiplexed on each 20MHz Channel depending on the PHY_CONFIG.PhyConfigPrimaryChan value so that the Primary20 Mhz subband is always mapped to Channel 0.

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_SIGNAL_RMS_GAIN_COMP_INST[0][0]
register.comment: OFDM digital energy measured in each channel per selected Rx antenna. This is a fixed value per PPDU reception. The energy is multiplexed on each 20MHz Channel depending on the PHY_CONFIG.PhyConfigPrimaryChan value so that the Primary20 Mhz subband is always mapped to Channel 0.

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_SIGNAL_RMS_GAIN_COMP_INST[0][1]

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_CCK_RMS_GAIN_COMP_CONT_20MHZ[0]
register.comment: CCK energy per selected Rx antenna

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_CCK_RMS_GAIN_COMP_CONT_10MHZ[0]
register.comment: CCK energy per selected Rx antenna within 10MHz

register.comment: CCK energy per selected Rx antenna. This is a fixed value per PPDU reception

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_CCK_RMS_GAIN_COMP_INST_10MHZ[0]
register.comment: CCK energy per selected Rx antenna within 10MHz. This is a fixed value per PPDU reception

register.comment: Digital and analog gain settings applied across the whole operating bandwidth

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_STF_AUTOCORRELATION[0][0]
register.comment: STF autocorrelation value on each 20MHz channel for each antenna

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_ED[0]
register.comment: Energy detected on each 20MHz channel for each antenna. Primary 20MHz channel is always mapped to channel 0; Secondary 20MHz channel is always mapped to channel 1; Secondary 40MHz channel is always mapped to channel 2 and 3; etc.

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_PACKET_CCA[0]
register.comment: CCA for each 20MHz subband per selected Rx antenna. The energy is multiplexed on each 20MHz Channel depending on the PHY_CONFIG.PhyConfigPrimaryChan value so that the Primary20 Mhz channel is always mapped to Channel 0; Secondary20 MHz is always mapped to Channel 1; Channel 2 and Channel 3 always correspond to the Secondary 40. Channel 0 is the lowest 20MHz subband

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_PACKET_START[0]
register.comment: This is a fine detection using STF symbols on each Rx antenna. The Primary20 Mhz channel is always mapped to Channel 0; The Secondary20 MHz is always mapped to Channel 1; Channel 2 and Channel 3 always correspond to the Secondary 40. Channel 0 is the lowest 20MHz subband

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_PACKET_SYNC[0]
register.comment: LTF preamble detection on each Rx antenna and for each 20MHz channel

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_RX_PAYLOAD_DET[0]
register.comment: Payload detection on each Rx antenna The Primary20 Mhz channel is always mapped to Channel 0; The Secondary20 MHz is always mapped to Channel 1; Channel 2 and Channel 3 always correspond to the Secondary 40. Channel 0 is the lowest 20MHz subband

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_INTERRUPT_DISABLE
register.comment: Interrupt enable/disable and pending events clear. Note that in Mxl450 the CPU interrupts bypass this register and are connected directly to the CPU interrupt controller. This register can still be used for polling operation. - Disable interrupt/read enable status

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_INTERRUPT_ENABLE
register.comment: Interrupt enable/disable and pending events clear. Note that in Mxl450 the CPU interrupts bypass this register and are connected directly to the CPU interrupt controller. This register can still be used for polling operation. - Enable interrupt/read enable status

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_INTERRUPT_CLEAR
register.comment: Interrupt enable/disable and pending events clear. Note that in Mxl450 the CPU interrupts bypass this register and are connected directly to the CPU interrupt controller. This register can still be used for polling operation. - Clear interrupt/read pending interrupt status

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_INTERRUPT_RAW
register.comment: Interrupt enable/disable and pending events clear. Note that in Mxl450 the CPU interrupts bypass this register and are connected directly to the CPU interrupt controller. This register can still be used for polling operation. - Read incoming interrupt status

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_OVERRIDE
register.comment: State machine debug overrides

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_STATE
register.comment: State machine current state of FSM and counters for debug inspection

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_COADJ_BRACKEN_STATUS
register.comment: Status of Bracken core - 8 LS bits of PC for last 4 clock cycles (LS is most recent)

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_COADJ_COMMS
register.comment: General Communication register. Bracken gets an interrupt event when this is writtem

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_COADJ_TIMER
register.comment: Timer initial value, downcount at core clk rate starts on write

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_COADJ_MEM_ADDR
register.comment: Coadj Code/Data Mem Address. MSBs=2'b00: DataStore, 2'b10: Core internal regs, 2'b11: Local regs

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_COADJ_MEM_WDATA
register.comment: Coadj Code/Data Mem Write Data - auto increments address on write

register.name: PHY_FLEXIMAC_COADJ_MEM_RDATA
register.comment: Coadj Code/Data Mem Read Data - auto increments address on read

register.name: RAMS_NIC_AXI2MEM_READ_STATUS
register.comment: Status of the NIC-400->RAMS AXI2MEM block.

register.comment: Status of the NIC-400->RAMS AXI2MEM block.

register.comment: Status of the NIC-400->RAMS AXI2MEM block.

register.name: RAMS_ETR_AXI2MEM_WRITE_STATUS
register.comment: Status of the NIC-400->RAMS AXI2MEM block.

register.name: RAMS_MAC_IF_ADDR_CHECK_START[1]
register.comment: Start 4k page number for address checking. The logic checks for the address being greater than or equal to this number.

register.name: RAMS_MAC_IF_ADDR_CHECK_START[2]
register.comment: Start 4k page number for address checking. The logic checks for the address being greater than or equal to this number.

register.comment: Start 4k page number for address checking. The logic checks for the address being greater than or equal to this number.

block.name: wl_enc_dma_0
block.comment: Wireless LAN Encryption accelerator DMA registers for RAM interface version

register.name: ENC_DMA_INT_CLEAR_I0
register.comment: Clear interrupt status events.

register.name: ENC_DMA_INT_MASK_I0
register.comment: Disable interrupt sources if a mask bit is set to '1'.

register.name: ENC_DMA_INT_CAUSE_I0
register.comment: Interrupt events status.

register.name: ENC_DMA_INT_DMA_DONE_COUNT_I0
register.comment: Number of DMA_DONE events required to generate a DMA_DONE interrupt event. 0 = 1 event required to generate interrupt. 255 = 256 events required to generate interrupt.

register.name: ENC_DMA_INT_DMA_DONE_COUNT_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Current status of the number of DMA_DONE events since the last reset or interrupt clear.

register.name: ENC_DMA_INT_DST_COUNT_SENT_CLEAR_I0
register.comment: Write '1' to clear the DST_COUNT interrupt event sent flag and allow subsequent DST_COUNT interrupts for the current DMA operation.

register.name: ENC_DMA_INT_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: Interrupt generation configuration.

register.name: ENC_DMA_RAW_NONCE_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: Length in bytes of the raw mode IV/Nonce.

register.name: ENC_DMA_RAW_AAD_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: Length in bytes of the raw mode AAD.

register.name: ENC_DMA_RAW_MIC_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: Length in bytes of the raw mode MIC output.

register.name: ENC_DMA_ENCR_TYPE_I0
register.comment: Encryption operation, one of:

register.name: ENC_DMA_KEY_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: Encryption key length 128 or 256

register.name: ENC_DMA_FRAME_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: Frame body length in octets

register.name: ENC_DMA_HDR_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: Frame header length in octets

register.name: ENC_DMA_ENC_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: Contains the following configuration bits:

register.name: ENC_DMA_PRIORITY_OCTET_I0
register.comment: Priority octet used in TKIP MIC calculation. Set to zero in this case. For CCMP operation, bits set to 1 in this octet will be set to one in the Nonce Flags Octet. It should be set to 0x10 for Management frames but should be set to 0xFF for Cisco CCX S67 compatibility; it must be set to 0x0 otherwise. (Refer to 802.11w section 8.3.3.3.3)

register.name: ENC_DMA_FC_MASK_I0
register.comment: Frame Control Mask. Determines which Frame Control bits are masked (i.e. included in the AAD calculation) in CCMP mode. Its default value is 0xC78F. (Refer to 802.11n section 8.3.3.3.2)

register.name: ENC_DMA_AAD_QC_MASK_I0
register.comment: Additional Authentication Data QoS Control field mask value for CCMP encryption. Set to 0x0F unless both the STA and its peer have their SPP A-MSDU Capable fields set to 1. In that case, set to 0x8F. (Refer to 802.11n section 8.3.3.3.2 g)

register.name: ENC_DMA_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: Configuration settings for the DMA logic.

register.name: ENC_DMA_KEY_ADDRESS_I0
register.comment: Location in RAM address space of the encryption key to be used in single buffer mode.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BUFFER_START_ADDRESS_I0
register.comment: Start address of the source buffer in single buffer mode.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BUFFER_START_ADDRESS_I0
register.comment: Start address of the destination buffer in single buffer mode.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BUFFER_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: Length of the source buffer in bytes in single buffer mode.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BUFFER_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: Length of the destination buffer in bytes in single buffer mode.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BUFFER_NEXT_I0
register.comment: Offset for the next operation. This is a result of (current operation start + length) % buffer end address.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BUFFER_NEXT_I0
register.comment: Offset for the next operation. This is a result of (current operation start + length) % buffer end address.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SET_SRC_BUFFER_NEXT_I0
register.comment: Set the offset for the next operation. This overrides the last hardware-calculated value.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SET_DST_BUFFER_NEXT_I0
register.comment: Set the offset for the next operation. This overrides the last hardware-calculated value.

register.name: ENC_DMA_AUTO_DST_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: In auto length mode this shows the calculated length of the destination data written out.

register.name: ENC_DMA_FRAME_CONTROL_FIELD_I0
register.comment: In auto header length mode this is used to work out the length of the header.

register.name: ENC_DMA_AUTO_HEADER_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: In auto header length mode this shows the calculated header length.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DESCRIPTOR_TABLE_START_ADDRESS_I0
register.comment: Start address of descriptor table. Write to update the external registers.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DESCRIPTOR_TABLE_LENGTH_I0
register.comment: Number of entries in the descriptor table. Each entry is 4 bytes long. This allows the table to be continuous and wrap around.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DESCRIPTOR_TABLE_ADD_I0
register.comment: Write a value to this register to indicate that more entries have been added to the descriptor table.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DESCRIPTOR_TABLE_CURRENT_ADDRESS_I0
register.comment: Current address of the descriptor table.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DESCRIPTOR_TABLE_ENTRY_COUNT_I0
register.comment: Count of entries currently in the descriptor table.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SKIP_OFFSET_SRC_I0
register.comment: The number of bytes to skip at the start of each descriptor table or single buffer mode operation. This is added to the current offset before beginning the operation. It applies to all operations, including straight DMA operations.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SKIP_OFFSET_DST_I0
register.comment: The number of bytes to skip at the start of each descriptor table or single buffer mode operation. This is added to the current offset before beginning the operation. It applies to all operations, including straight DMA operations.

register.comment: Source list status - length.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BYPASS_STATUS_I0[7]
register.comment: Source list status - bypass.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_WRAPPABLE_STATUS_I0[7]
register.comment: Source list status - wrappable.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SG_SRC_PAUSE_BYTE_COUNT_I0
register.comment: Scatter-gather per-operation setting. The number of bytes to read from the source before halting and generating an interrupt (ENC_DMA_INT_SRC_PAUSE). This is the initial value captured when loading the SG registers on an ENC DMA start operation. This feature is disabled when this register is set to 0.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SG_DST_COUNT_INT_EN_I0
register.comment: Scatter-gather per-operation setting. Set this to 1 to cause an interrupt when the bytes written to memory passes the threshold set in ENC_DMA_DST_COUNT_BYTE_COUNT. This is set once per DMA operation, not per scatter-gather list entry.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_PAUSE_BYTE_COUNT_I0
register.comment: This is the override for the currently-active set in the SG operation queue. Writing to this *overwrites* the currently-active value inside the ENC DMA block. The value can be increased as required or set to 0. This feature is disabled when this register is set to 0.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_PAUSE_BYTE_COUNT_ACTIVE_STATUS_I0
register.comment: The currently-active byte count at which the source reading will be paused.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_COUNT_BYTE_COUNT_I0
register.comment: The number of bytes to write to the destination before generating an interrupt (ENC_DMA_INT_DST_COUNT). The value can be increased as required. This feature is disabled when this register is set to 0.

register.name: ENC_DMA_SRC_BYTE_COUNT_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Count of the number of bytes read from RAM for the currently-active operation.

register.name: ENC_DMA_DST_BYTE_COUNT_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Count of the number of bytes written to RAM for the currently-active operation.

register.name: ENC_DMA_STROBE_I0
register.comment: Write to individual bits in thie register to perform various operations. Only one bit whould be set at a time.

register.name: ENC_DMA_QUEUE_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Indicates the number of operations completed. Software must read this number before programming any configuration registers, and may write configuration registers only when this number is less than 2 (in SG mode).

register.name: ENC_DMA_OPERATION_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Indicates the outcome of the corresponding encryption operation.

register.name: ENC_DMA_STATE_I0
register.comment: DMA current state for debug purposes

register.name: ENC_DMA_RAM_CTRL_STATE_I0
register.comment: DMA current state for debug purposes

register.name: ENC_DMA_STATE_FIFOS_I0
register.comment: DMA current state for debug purposes

register.name: ENC_CORE_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Encryption accelerator state for debug purposes

register.name: ENC_DMA_AHB_REG_CLK_REQ_EXTEND_CYCLES_I0
register.comment: Number of cycles to extend the AHB clock request for after the register access has completed.

register.name: ENC_DMA_MSDU_FILTER_EN_I0[0]
register.comment: Enable MSDU filtering on decryption.

register.name: ENC_DMA_MSDU_FILTER_ETHERTYPE_I0[0]
register.comment: Configuration for MSDU filters. Ethertype to match.

register.name: ENC_DMA_MSDU_FILTER_BYTES_I0[0]
register.comment: Additional bytes to attempt to match.

register.name: ENC_DMA_MSDU_FILTER_MATCH_I0[0]
register.comment: Filter match flag. Ethertype has matched and (byte one and/or byte two).

register.name: ENC_DMA_ADDR_CHECK_START_I0[1]
register.comment: Start 4k page number for address checking. The logic checks for the address being greater than or equal to this number.

register.name: ENC_DMA_ADDR_CHECK_START_I0[2]
register.comment: Start 4k page number for address checking. The logic checks for the address being greater than or equal to this number.

register.name: ENC_DMA_ADDR_CHECK_END_I0[1]
register.comment: End 4k page number for address checking. The logic checks for the address being lower than this number.

register.comment: End 4k page number for address checking. The logic checks for the address being lower than this number.

register.comment: End 4k page number for address checking. The logic checks for the address being lower than this number.

register.comment: End 4k page number for address checking. The logic checks for the address being lower than this number.

register.name: ENC_DMA_ADDR_CHECK_EN_I0
register.comment: Set a bit to 1 to enable the corresponding address check region.

register.name: ENC_DMA_ADDR_CHECK_STATUS_I0
register.comment: Interrupt status of read address AXI channel.

register.name: ENC_DMA_ADDR_CHECK_CLEAR_I0
register.comment: Write a 1 to clear the interrupt status.

register.name: ENC_DMA_ADDR_CHECK_ERROR_ADDR_I0
register.comment: The address which caused the error.

register.name: MAC_ACC_TX_RX_CONTROL
register.comment: TX/RX immediate control

register.name: MAC_ACC_PSDU_LENGTH
register.comment: PSDU length used to pad Zero-Length delimiters for an A-MPDU

register.name: MAC_ACC_TIMER
register.comment: Current value of MAC ACC's 32-bit Timer

register.name: MAC_ACC_STATUS
register.comment: General status register

register.name: MAC_ACC_INTERRUPT_STATUS
register.comment: Interrupt status. See MAC_ACC_INTERRUPT_ENUMS for bit fields

register.name: MAC_ACC_INTERRUPT_ENABLE
register.comment: Interrupt enable. See MAC_ACC_INTERRUPT_ENUMS for bit fields

register.name: MAC_ACC_INTERRUPT_CLEAR
register.comment: Interrupt clear. See MAC_ACC_INTERRUPT_ENUMS for bit fields

register.name: MAC_ACC_RX_DWARF_MPDU_COUNT
register.comment: Count of MPDUs that were ignored because the length indicated was less than 4 bytes. This includes standalone MPDUs and MPDUs sent as part of an AMPDU.

register.name: MAC_ACC_RX_GOOD_MPDU_COUNT
register.comment: Count of MPDUs that passed FCS

register.name: MAC_ACC_RX_BAD_MPDU_COUNT
register.comment: Count of MPDUs that fails FCS

register.name: MAC_ACC_RX_PSDU_COUNT
register.comment: Count of IDLE=>MACPHY_RX_VALID transitions

register.name: MAC_ACC_RX_ZERO_LEN_MPDU_COUNT
register.comment: Count of standalone MPDUs that were ignored because the length indicated was null.

register.name: MAC_ACC_TX_STARVATION_COUNT
register.comment: Count of PSDU bytes going to the PHY upto the first starvation byte

register.name: MAC_ACC_TX_STARVATION_LENGTH
register.comment: Length of MPDU that contained TX starvation

register.comment: Status of the cause(s) that triggered MAC_ACC_INTERRUPT_RX_OFF_REQUEST_ERROR

register.comment: Timestamp block 480MHz cycle count

block.name: wl_mac_if
block.comment: Wireless LAN FlexiMAC MAC Interface registers

register.name: MAC_IF_CONTROL
register.comment: General control register (state is persistant)

register.name: MAC_IF_CONTROL_AMNESIC
register.comment: General control register (state is transitory). Writing a 0 to a bit has no effect. Returns zero if read (not last value written)

register.name: MAC_IF_STATUS
register.comment: General status register

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_BUFFER_START
register.comment: Address of start of Receive Buffer. Offset from start of RAMS. Units of 1k bytes. Address = MAC_IF_RX_BUFFER_START*1024

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_BUFFER_SIZE
register.comment: Size of Receive Buffer. Units of 1k bytes. Offset of 1k bytes. 0 => 1k bytes, 1 => 2k bytes, 255 => 256k bytes

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_GIVE
register.comment: Receive Buffer Write Pointer. Updated 'live' as each quadword is written to RAMS

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_GIVE_EMEND
register.comment: Allows firmware to modify Receive Buffer Write Pointer. Must only be written when Receive Buffer Write Pointer is not in active use. Entire register must be written atomically. If read, this register will return the last value written (not zero)

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_TAKE
register.comment: Receive Buffer Read Pointer. Entire register must be written atomically

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_TRIGGER
register.comment: Controls the generation of the Receive Give Interrupt. Entire register must be written atomically

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER_START
register.comment: Address of start of Transmit Buffer. Offset from start of RAMS. Units of 1k bytes. Address = MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER_START*1024

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER_SIZE
register.comment: Size of Transmit Buffer 0. Units of 1k bytes. Offset of 1k bytes. 0 => 1k bytes, 1 => 2k bytes, 255 => 256k bytes

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_STRUCTURE
register.comment: Transmit Structure Table Read Pointer. Address of next entry in Transmit Structure Table that hardware will read. Offset from start of RAMS. Updated 'live' as each entry is read. Two lsb always 0. (Debug aid)

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_STRUCTURE_EMEND
register.comment: Allows firmware to modify Transmit Structure Table Read Pointer. Two lsb ignored and treated as 0. If read, this register will return last value written (not zero)

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BASE
register.comment: Transmit Buffer Base Pointer. Defines the start of valid data in the Transmit Buffer. May be (temporarily) set 'above' MAC_IF_TX_GIVE to indicate an area of the Transmit Buffer (give -> base) which does not and will not contain valid data. If firmware falls behind schedule creating the Transmit Buffer's data, it can abandon the creation of some data, with the aim of meeting the schedule for later data

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_GIVE
register.comment: Transmit Buffer Write Pointer. Defines the end of valid data in the Transmit Buffer. Entire register must be written atomically

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_TAKE
register.comment: Transmit Buffer Read Pointer. Updated 'live' as each quadword is read from Transmit Buffer

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_TAKE_EMEND
register.comment: Allows firmware to modify Transmit Buffer Read Pointer. Must only be written when Transmit Buffer Read Pointer is not in active use. Entire register must be written atomically. If read, this register will return the last value written (not zero)

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_TRIGGER
register.comment: Controls the generation of the Transmit Take Interrupt. Entire register must be written atomically

register.name: MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS
register.comment: Interrupt Raw Status register. This is a 'sticky' register. The (transient) interrupt sources can (only) set the bits to 1. Bits may be cleared to 0 by writing to MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_CLEAR. When the MAC IF is Disabled, the interrupt sources are prevented from updating INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS

register.name: MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_STATUS
register.comment: Interrupt Status register. Value in this register is MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS ANDed with MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_ENABLE. If one or more of the bits in this register are 1, then the interrupt output signal from the MAC IF will be asserted

register.name: MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_ENABLE
register.comment: Interrupt Enable register. Allows the various interrupt sources to be enabled / masked. If masked (i.e. a bit is a 0), then the interrupt source will not cause an interrupt, but the source may still be polled via MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS

register.name: MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_CLEAR
register.comment: Interrupt Clear register. Writing a 1 to a bit will (typically) clear (set to 0) the corresponding bit in MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS. Writing a 0 has no effect. Returns zero if read (not last value written)

register.name: MAC_IF_DEBUG_SELECT
register.comment: Debug Select

register.name: MAC_IF_DEBUG_STATUS
register.comment: Debug Status

register.name: MAC_IF_DEBUG_RX1
register.comment: Debug Receive 1. Various state from Receive Controller. (Debug aid)

register.name: MAC_IF_DEBUG_RX2
register.comment: Debug Receive 2. Various state from Receive Controller. (Debug aid)

register.name: MAC_IF_DEBUG_TX1
register.comment: Debug Transmit 1. Various state from Transmit Controller. (Debug aid)

register.name: MAC_IF_DEBUG_TX2
register.comment: Debug Transmit 2. Various state from Transmit Controller. (Debug aid)

register.name: MAC_IF_DEBUG_TX3
register.comment: Debug Transmit 3. Various state from Transmit Controller. (Debug aid)

register.name: MACPP_VERSION
register.comment: Dummy version string. LSbit is used in simulations for chip id (0 or 1).

register.name: MACPP_PERW_REGISTER_HASH
register.comment: Contains a 16-bit hash of all the PERW register tree source used in the IP.

register.name: MACPP_PIO_DRIVE

register.name: MACPP_PIO_DRIVE_EN

register.name: MACPP_IRQ_MAC2WLBT_CLR

register.name: MACPP_IRQ_WLBT2MAC_SET

register.name: MACPP_IRQ_WLBT2MAC_CLR
register.comment: Write 1 in the corresponding bit to clear an IRQ line from main WLBT PP. Writing 0 has no effect.

register.name: MACPP_IRQ_WLBT2MAC

register.name: MACPP_TIMER_TIME

register.name: MACPP_REGS_FAILED_ADDRESS

register.name: MACPP_REGS_STATUS

register.name: MACPP_COEX_ALLOWED

register.name: BIT_SHIFTER_SHIFT_VAL[0]
register.comment: Amount to shift data as a 2's compliment number. Range is -255 to 255. Positive values shift left. Zero extension is used. Shift occurs once on writing this register. Shifts less than or equal to 63 bits take one cycle. Larger shifts take up to 5 clock cycles. Accesses to any BitShifter registers when the shifter is active results in the bus being waited until the shifter has completed

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CCK_RSSI_TARGET_DELTA[0]

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_ENABLES[1]
register.comment: Coadj general config register

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_CONFIG[1]
register.comment: Coadj general config register

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_CONFIG2[1]
register.comment: Coadj general config register 2

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_STATUS[1]
register.comment: Coadj general status register

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_BRACKEN_STATUS[1]
register.comment: Status of Bracken core - 8 LS bits of PC for last 4 clock cycles (LS is most recent)

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_COMMS[1]
register.comment: General Communication register. Bracken gets an interrupt event when this is writtem

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_TIMER[1]
register.comment: Timer initial value, downcount at core clk rate starts on write

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_MEM_ADDR[1]
register.comment: Coadj Code/Data Mem Address. MSBs=2'b00: DataStore, 2'b10: Core internal regs, 2'b11: Local regs

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_MEM_WDATA[1]
register.comment: Coadj Code/Data Mem Write Data - auto increments address on write

register.name: WL_RADIO_COADJ_MEM_RDATA[1]
register.comment: Coadj Code/Data Mem Read Data - auto increments address on read

register.name: WL_RADIO_ZIPPY_TO_RF_FLAGS[1]
register.comment: Zippy flag data (info and channel) to be sent to RFIC

register.name: WL_RADIO_ZIPPY_TO_BB_FILTER[1]
register.comment: Filter bitmap for Zippy channels that cause an interrupt to be raised on traffic to the BBIC

register.name: WL_RADIO_ZIPPY_TO_RF_CFG[1]
register.comment: Zippy channel configuration for SW data to the BBIC

register.name: WL_RADIO_ZIPPY_TO_BB_FLAGS[1]
register.comment: Zippy flag data to the BBIC, plus latched Valid and Ack

register.name: WL_DEBUG_SEL
register.comment: Select for WLan_pd level debug mux

register.name: WL_DEBUG_STATUS
register.comment: Debug data at WLan_pd level

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_POSN_3_0
register.comment: Select for WLan_pd level debug mux

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_POSN_7_4
register.comment: Select for WLan_pd level debug mux

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_POSN_11_8
register.comment: Select for WLan_pd level debug mux

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_POSN_15_12
register.comment: Select for WLan_pd level debug mux

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_BUS_0_SEL
register.comment: Source bus select for intermediate bus 0 (select one of up to 32 busses)

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_BUS_1_SEL
register.comment: Source bus select for intermediate bus 1 (select one of up to 32 busses)

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_BUS_2_SEL
register.comment: Source bus select for intermediate bus 2 (select one of up to 32 busses)

register.name: WL_DEBUG_COMB_BUS_3_SEL
register.comment: Source bus select for intermediate bus 3 (select one of up to 32 busses)
